content: How does the lang team feel about adding more WF checks to lang items? (#9307) Not entirely sure if this really is a lang issue, or just compiler. Some PRs have been made (#87875, #86246, #88782) and it would be nice to know if these should have a "larger plan", or if these one off PRs are helpful

https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/9307#issuecomment-505066460 is probably still my opinion, though if the checks are simple it seems not too bad, but I do think this is pretty squarely T-compiler fwiw.

Jack Huey said:

How does the lang team feel about adding more WF checks to lang items? (#9307)

My opinion is that everything about lang items themselves is not a lang concern. (The functionality they expose to stable users is relevant to lang or libs, but their existence -- how they're defined and used, or vs hardcoding paths, distinct attributes, etc -- is entirely up to compiler.)
I somewhat expected this interpretation, but wanted to make sure everything was good
